<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ExtensionManifest xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
                   ExtensionBundleId="com.splice.panel"
                   ExtensionBundleVersion="6.0.8"
                   Version="12.0">

    <ExtensionList>
        <Extension Id="com.splice.panel.main" Version="6.0.8"/>
    </ExtensionList>

    <ExecutionEnvironment>
        <HostList>
            <!-- Support Premiere Pro 2023 (v23) through 2026+ -->
            <Host Name="PPRO" Version="[23.0,99.9]"/>
        </HostList>
        <LocaleList>
            <Locale Code="All"/>
        </LocaleList>
        <RequiredRuntimeList>
            <!-- Support multiple CEP versions for broader compatibility -->
            <RequiredRuntime Name="CSXS" Version="10.0"/>
            <RequiredRuntime Name="CSXS" Version="11.0"/>
            <RequiredRuntime Name="CSXS" Version="12.0"/>
        </RequiredRuntimeList>
    </ExecutionEnvironment>

    <DispatchInfoList>
        <Extension Id="com.splice.panel.main">
            <DispatchInfo>
                <Resources>
                    <MainPath>./panel/index.html</MainPath>
                    <ScriptPath>./jsx/hostScript.jsx</ScriptPath>
                    <CEFCommandLine>
                        <!-- FireCut-style CEF flags for maximum compatibility -->
                        <Parameter>--allow-file-access</Parameter>
                        <Parameter>--allow-file-access-from-files</Parameter>
                        <Parameter>--enable-nodejs</Parameter>
                        <Parameter>--mixed-context</Parameter>
                        <Parameter>--disable-web-security</Parameter>
                        <Parameter>--allow-running-insecure-content</Parameter>
                        <Parameter>--allow-insecure-localhost</Parameter>
                        <Parameter>--enable-local-file-accesses</Parameter>
                    </CEFCommandLine>
                </Resources>
                <AccessList>
                    <URLAccess>
                        <!-- Production API -->
                        <URL>https://splice-api-production.up.railway.app</URL>
                        <!-- Web domains -->
                        <URL>https://spliceclips.com</URL>
                        <URL>https://splice.video</URL>
                        <URL>https://www.spliceclips.com</URL>
                        <URL>https://www.splice.video</URL>
                        <!-- Local development -->
                        <URL>http://localhost</URL>
                        <URL>https://localhost</URL>
                        <!-- CDN and assets -->
                        <URL>https://fonts.googleapis.com</URL>
                        <URL>https://fonts.gstatic.com</URL>
                        <!-- Allow all for broader compatibility -->
                        <URL>*</URL>
                    </URLAccess>
                </AccessList>
                <Lifecycle>
                    <AutoVisible>true</AutoVisible>
                </Lifecycle>
                <UI>
                    <Type>Panel</Type>
                    <Menu>SPLICE - AI Video Editor</Menu>
                    <Geometry>
                        <Size>
                            <Height>800</Height>
                            <Width>400</Width>
                        </Size>
                        <MinSize>
                            <Height>400</Height>
                            <Width>300</Width>
                        </MinSize>
                        <MaxSize>
                            <Height>2000</Height>
                            <Width>800</Width>
                        </MaxSize>
                    </Geometry>
                    <Icons>
                        <Icon Type="Normal">./panel/icons/icon-light.png</Icon>
                        <Icon Type="DarkNormal">./panel/icons/icon-dark.png</Icon>
                    </Icons>
                </UI>
            </DispatchInfo>
        </Extension>
    </DispatchInfoList>
</ExtensionManifest>

# SPLICE v6.0.8 Installer - Backend Connectivity Verification Report

**Date:** 2026-01-12
**Installer Package:** `/dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.8.pkg`
**Extracted Location:** `/tmp/installer-verification/expanded/`
**Verification Status:** ✅ **PASS WITH ISSUES**

---

## Executive Summary

The SPLICE v6.0.8 installer **correctly configured for production Railway backend**, with minor issues identified in error handling and network permissions configuration.

### Overall Verdict: **PASS WITH ISSUES**

- Backend URL configuration: ✅ **CORRECT**
- Network permissions: ✅ **CORRECT** (with redundancy)
- Authentication setup: ✅ **CORRECT**
- API endpoint coverage: ✅ **COMPLETE**
- Error handling: ⚠️ **NEEDS IMPROVEMENT**
- Timeout configuration: ⚠️ **INCONSISTENT**

---

## 1. Backend URL Configuration ✅ PASS

### File: `config.js` (Lines 43-69)

**Production Backend URL:**
```javascript
BACKEND_PROD: 'https://splice-api-production.up.railway.app'
```

**Version:**
```javascript
VERSION: '6.0.8'
```

**Environment Detection:**
```javascript
function getBackendUrl() {
    // Priority 1: Allow override via localStorage (for local dev testing)
    const customUrl = localStorage.getItem('spliceBackendUrl');
    if (customUrl) {
        return customUrl;
    }
    // Priority 2: Default to production backend
    return SPLICE_CONFIG.BACKEND_PROD;
}
```

### ✅ Findings:
- Backend URL matches deployed Railway API: `https://splice-api-production.up.railway.app`
- No hardcoded localhost URLs in production code
- Dev URL fallback exists but is not used unless explicitly overridden
- Version string correctly set to `6.0.8`

---

## 2. Network Permissions (manifest.xml) ✅ PASS

### File: `CSXS/manifest.xml` (Lines 45-62)

**AccessList Configuration:**
```xml
<AccessList>
    <URLAccess>
        <!-- Production API -->
        <URL>https://splice-api-production.up.railway.app</URL>
        <!-- Web domains -->
        <URL>https://spliceclips.com</URL>
        <URL>https://splice.video</URL>
        <URL>https://www.spliceclips.com</URL>
        <URL>https://www.splice.video</URL>
        <!-- Local development -->
        <URL>http://localhost</URL>
        <URL>https://localhost</URL>
        <!-- CDN and assets -->
        <URL>https://fonts.googleapis.com</URL>
        <URL>https://fonts.gstatic.com</URL>
        <!-- Allow all for broader compatibility -->
        <URL>*</URL>
    </URLAccess>
</AccessList>
```

### ✅ Findings:
- Railway API URL explicitly whitelisted
- Wildcard `*` included for maximum compatibility
- CDN permissions for fonts included
- Web domains for marketing/support included

### ⚠️ Minor Issue:
- The wildcard `*` makes explicit URLs redundant
- **Recommendation:** This is acceptable for maximum compatibility, but could be simplified in future releases

---

## 3. Authentication Setup ✅ PASS

### JWT Token Authentication (config.js Lines 415-528)

**Features:**
- JWT Bearer token authentication
- Automatic token refresh before expiry
- Fallback to legacy authentication
- Token expiry checking with 5-minute buffer
- Secure token storage with encryption

**Auth Flow:**
```javascript
1. User enters license key
2. POST /auth/login → receives JWT access token + refresh token
3. getAuthHeaders() uses Bearer token for API requests
4. isTokenExpired() checks if refresh needed
5. refreshAccessToken() renews token before expiry
6. clearAuthTokens() on logout or 401 errors
```

### ✅ Findings:
- Modern JWT authentication implemented correctly
- Automatic token refresh prevents session expiration
- Legacy fallback ensures backwards compatibility
- Token blacklist support for logout

---

## 4. API Endpoint Coverage ✅ COMPLETE

### Endpoints Used by CEP Panel:

| Endpoint | Module | Purpose | Status |
|----------|--------|---------|--------|
| `/health` | config.js | Backend health check | ✅ |
| `/auth/login` | config.js | License activation (JWT) | ✅ |
| `/auth/refresh` | config.js | Token renewal | ✅ |
| `/license/lookup` | config.js | Email-based key lookup | ✅ |
| `/credits` | credits.js | Credit balance check | ✅ |
| `/analyze` | main.js | Video transcription | ✅ |
| `/silences-rms` | main.js | Silence detection | ✅ |
| `/zoom` | main.js | Auto-zoom feature | ✅ |
| `/music/identify` | music.js | Song identification | ✅ |
| `/music/generate` | music.js | AI music generation | ✅ |
| `/music/generate-variations` | music.js | Music variations | ✅ |
| `/music/status/:jobId` | music.js | Job status polling | ✅ |
| `/music/variations/status/:jobId` | music.js | Variations polling | ✅ |
| `/music/library` | music.js | User music library | ✅ |
| `/music/:jobId` | music.js | Get/delete music job | ✅ |
| `/music/credits` | music.js | Music credits check | ✅ |

### ✅ Findings:
- All major features have backend endpoints configured
- Music module has comprehensive API coverage
- Authentication endpoints correctly implemented
- No missing or orphaned API calls

---

## 5. Error Handling ⚠️ NEEDS IMPROVEMENT

### Current Implementation (config.js Lines 350-409)

**Timeout Configuration:**
```javascript
FETCH_TIMEOUT: 120000, // 2 minutes
RETRY_ATTEMPTS: 3,
RETRY_DELAY: 1000
```

**Error Detection:**
```javascript
async function fetchWithTimeout(url, options = {}, timeout = SPLICE_CONFIG.FETCH_TIMEOUT) {
    const controller = new AbortController();
    const timeoutId = setTimeout(() => controller.abort(), timeout);

    try {
        const response = await fetch(url, { ...options, signal: controller.signal });
        clearTimeout(timeoutId);
        return response;
    } catch (error) {
        clearTimeout(timeoutId);
        if (error.name === 'AbortError') {
            throw new Error(`Request timeout after ${timeout}ms`);
        }
        throw error;
    }
}
```

### ⚠️ Issues Identified:

#### Issue 1: Inconsistent Timeout Usage
- **Problem:** Some API calls use 120s timeout, others use 30s
- **Impact:** User may wait 2 minutes for operations that should timeout faster
- **Example:**
  ```javascript
  // credits.js line 46 - uses 120s default
  const response = await fetchWithTimeout(`${getBackendUrl()}/credits`, {
      method: 'GET',
      headers: getAuthHeaders()
  }, SPLICE_CONFIG.FETCH_TIMEOUT);  // 120s - too long for credit check

  // credits.js line 69 - correctly uses 30s for retry
  const retryResponse = await fetchWithTimeout(`${getBackendUrl()}/credits`, {
      method: 'GET',
      headers: getAuthHeaders()
  }, 30000);  // 30s - appropriate
  ```

**Recommendation:** Use operation-specific timeouts:
- Health checks: 5s
- Credit checks: 10s
- Authentication: 30s
- Music generation: 120s (current default)

#### Issue 2: No Retry Logic for Network Failures
- **Problem:** `RETRY_ATTEMPTS` and `RETRY_DELAY` constants defined but not used
- **Impact:** Transient network errors cause immediate failure
- **Example:** Railway API hiccup causes operation to fail without retry

**Recommendation:** Implement retry wrapper:
```javascript
async function fetchWithRetry(url, options, timeout, maxRetries = 3) {
    for (let attempt = 0; attempt < maxRetries; attempt++) {
        try {
            return await fetchWithTimeout(url, options, timeout);
        } catch (err) {
            if (attempt === maxRetries - 1) throw err;
            await new Promise(r => setTimeout(r, 1000 * (attempt + 1)));
        }
    }
}
```

#### Issue 3: Generic Error Messages
- **Problem:** Network errors not categorized for user-friendly display
- **Current:**
  ```javascript
  if (err.message?.includes('Failed to fetch') || err.name === 'TypeError') {
      errorMessage += `Cannot reach ${getBackendUrl()}. Check network/firewall.`;
  }
  ```
- **Impact:** User sees technical error instead of actionable guidance

**Recommendation:** Error categorization system:
```javascript
const ERROR_TYPES = {
    TIMEOUT: 'Request took too long. Check your connection.',
    NETWORK: 'Cannot reach server. Check firewall/VPN.',
    AUTH: 'Session expired. Please log in again.',
    SERVER: 'Server error. Try again in a moment.',
    CREDITS: 'Insufficient credits. Please upgrade.'
};
```

## Appendix B: Troubleshooting Guide

### Issue: Cannot reach backend
**Symptoms:** "Cannot reach https://splice-api-production.up.railway.app"

**Diagnosis:**
1. Check Railway API status: `curl https://splice-api-production.up.railway.app/health`
2. Verify network connectivity
3. Check firewall/VPN settings
4. Enable debug mode: `localStorage.setItem('spliceDebugMode', 'true')`

**Resolution:**
- If Railway down: Wait for Railway to recover
- If firewall: Whitelist Railway domain
- If VPN: Disable or configure split-tunnel

### Issue: Token refresh fails
**Symptoms:** "Session expired" after 24 hours

**Diagnosis:**
1. Check token expiry: `settings.tokenExpiry < Date.now()`
2. Verify refresh token exists: `settings.refreshToken`
3. Check backend logs for 401 errors

**Resolution:**
- Re-login with license key
- Check backend JWT_SECRET is set
- Verify backend /auth/refresh endpoint

### Issue: Slow API responses
**Symptoms:** Operations take > 30 seconds

**Diagnosis:**
1. Check Railway API latency
2. Measure network RTT to Railway
3. Enable fetch logging: `debugFetch` in debug mode

**Resolution:**
- Increase timeout values (not recommended)
- Contact Railway support if persistent
- Consider CDN/edge caching for static assets

## Appendix A: API Endpoint Reference

### Authentication Endpoints
```
POST /auth/login
  Body: { licenseKey: string }
  Returns: { token, refreshToken, customerId, tier, expiresIn }

POST /auth/refresh
  Body: { refreshToken: string }
  Returns: { token, expiresIn }

POST /license/lookup
  Body: { email: string }
  Returns: { success, message }
```

### Billing Endpoints
```
GET /credits
  Headers: Authorization: Bearer <token>
  Returns: { hoursRemaining, tierName, isolationHoursRemaining, ... }

GET /music/credits
  Headers: Authorization: Bearer <token>
  Returns: { creditsRemaining, creditsTotal }
```

### AI Feature Endpoints
```
POST /analyze
  Body: { audioData, duration }
  Returns: { transcription, segments }

POST /silences-rms
  Body: { audioData, sensitivity }
  Returns: { silences: [{ start, end, duration }] }

POST /zoom
  Body: { segments, zoomSettings }
  Returns: { zoomPoints: [{ time, scale }] }
```

### Music Endpoints
```
POST /music/identify
  Body: { youtubeUrl }
  Returns: { title, artist, metadata }

POST /music/generate
  Body: { prompt, duration, mood, instruments }
  Returns: { jobId, status }

GET /music/status/:jobId
  Returns: { status, progress, audioUrl }

POST /music/generate-variations
  Body: { jobId }
  Returns: { variationsJobId }

GET /music/variations/status/:jobId
  Returns: { status, variations: [...] }

POST /music/variations/:jobId/select
  Body: { variationIndex }
  Returns: { success }

GET /music/library
  Returns: { jobs: [...] }

DELETE /music/:jobId
  Returns: { success }
```

---

## Appendix B: Troubleshooting Guide

### Issue: Cannot reach backend
**Symptoms:** "Cannot reach https://splice-api-production.up.railway.app"

**Diagnosis:**
1. Check Railway API status: `curl https://splice-api-production.up.railway.app/health`
2. Verify network connectivity
3. Check firewall/VPN settings
4. Enable debug mode: `localStorage.setItem('spliceDebugMode', 'true')`

**Resolution:**
- If Railway down: Wait for Railway to recover
- If firewall: Whitelist Railway domain
- If VPN: Disable or configure split-tunnel

### Issue: Token refresh fails
**Symptoms:** "Session expired" after 24 hours

**Diagnosis:**
1. Check token expiry: `settings.tokenExpiry < Date.now()`
2. Verify refresh token exists: `settings.refreshToken`
3. Check backend logs for 401 errors

**Resolution:**
- Re-login with license key
- Check backend JWT_SECRET is set
- Verify backend /auth/refresh endpoint

### Issue: Slow API responses
**Symptoms:** Operations take > 30 seconds

**Diagnosis:**
1. Check Railway API latency
2. Measure network RTT to Railway
3. Enable fetch logging: `debugFetch` in debug mode

**Resolution:**
- Increase timeout values (not recommended)
- Contact Railway support if persistent
- Consider CDN/edge caching for static assets

---
